column2: HAWAII DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column6: HI

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You are driving behind another vehicle and notice that the driver is driving with one hand, talking to a passenger. You as a driver:
column4: know that you should avoid this bad habit.
column6: know that you should give the vehicle ahead extra room.
column8: know that the driver in the vehicle ahead is reducing his safety margin by being an inattentive driver.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column6: Yield right-of-way
column8: Narrow bridge

column2: 3. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column6: vehicles from both directions.
column8: vehicles from the left.

column2: 4. If traffic prevents you from crossing all the way across a set of railroad tracks:
column4: wait until the approaching train has come to a stop.
column6: proceed only when there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column8: wait until no trains are in sight.
column10: proceed only when at least one-half of your vehicle can cross the tracks safely.

column2: 5. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
column6: Anti-Collision Driving
column8: Defensive Driving

column2: 6. Before you back into the street, you should:
column4: sound your horn so that children will get out of the way.
column6: race your engine.
column8: check for traffic before getting in the car.
column10: check for children around your car.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated
column6: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column8: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column10: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column6: Warning, slippery when wet
column8: Keep left

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column6: Winding road ahead
column8: Steep grade ahead

column2: 10. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column6: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.
column8: slow down before entering the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.

column2: 11. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: before moving into the exit lane.
column6: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column8: once you see the toll booth.
column10: when you first see the exit sign.

column2: 12. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 13. You are driving and it begins to rain. You should:
column6: drive close behind the vehicle ahead.
column8: slow down and allow for weather conditions.

column2: 14. A flashing yellow light means:
column6: The light will soon change from green to red.
column8: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 15. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column8: Call an ambulance.
column10: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 16. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column6: look into the left side mirror.
column8: look into the rearview mirror.
column10: look into the right side mirror.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.

column2: 18. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column6: School ahead.
column8: High emphasis warning.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 19. When you are involved in an accident resulting in personal injury, you should:
column4: not move the injured unnecessarily, keep the injured warm, offer first aid and protect the victim from the oncoming traffic.
column6: always leave the injured where they are.
column8: moved the injured away from the scene immediately.
column10: stay away from the injured and call the police.

column2: 20. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column6: must not yield to
column8: must interrupt

column2: 21. When you are involved in an accident, you should:
column6: call the police.
column8: stop immediately.

column2: 22. Your BAC depends on:
column6: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column8: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 23. A red traffic sign means?
column6: Maintenance warning.
column8: Construction warning.

column2: 24. Signaling your intentions before turning or changing lanes:
column4: is necessary only during the maneuver, not before.
column6: is required by law, and is a safe driving habit.
column8: is necessary only if other traffic is present.
column10: is not necessary if you are driving slowly.

column2: 25. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column6: rectangle shaped.
column8: round.

column2: 26. What does this sign indicate?
column6: Low ground clearance railroad crossing
column8: Parallel railroad crossing (side road)

column2: 27. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column6: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.
column8: Try to move away safely.

column2: 28. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 29. What does a flashing red light mean?
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column6: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column8: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column10: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
